entities.name: bagman
entities.description: Bagman is mentioned as someone who should have sent someone to look for Rita Skeeter. He is not described in detail, but his name is used as a proper noun.

entities.name: crouch
entities.description: Mr. Crouch is mentioned as a high-ranking Ministry official who has been saying that Rita Skeeter should be found for weeks and weeks. He is described as being lucky because Rita hasn't found out about Winky.

entities.name: winky
entities.description: Winky is mentioned as a house-elf who was caught holding the wand that conjured the Dark Mark. She is described as being irresponsible, but not responsible for conjuring the Mark.

entities.name: rita skeeter
entities.description: Rita Skeeter is mentioned as a journalist who has been missing and should be found. She is described as being a problem because she might find out about Winky.

entities.name: percy
entities.description: Percy is mentioned as someone who quickly agrees with Mr. Crouch that Rita Skeeter should be found. He is described as being hotly defensive of Mr. Crouch.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone who is angry with Mr. Crouch for being mean to elves and not paying Winky. She is described as having a passionate voice.

entities.name: mr weasley
entities.description: Mr. Weasley is mentioned as someone who irritably says that Mr. Crouch is lucky Rita hasn't found out about Winky.

relationships.description: Mr. Crouch owns or has a house-elf named Winky, who was caught holding the wand that conjured the Dark Mark.
Mr. Crouch is concerned about Rita Skeeter being missing and might be found out by her.
Bagman should have sent someone to look for Rita Skeeter, but he didn't.
Hermione is angry with Mr. Crouch for being mean to elves and not paying Winky.
